intro: Wollastonia venosa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hop萧, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, grey-green leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces woody, cylindrical fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Wollastonia venosa is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks.
